intro: Sideroxylon atrovirens, commonly known as the blackwood tree, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, characterized by its dark, hard wood and dense foliage. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a glossy green appearance, while the flowers are small and clustered in cup-like structures. The plant is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in savannas and woodland areas. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and economic purposes.
